alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 8:09PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Humboldt County through 845 PM PDT... At 807 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a waterspout along a line extending from 13 miles west of Rio Dell to near Petrolia to 13 miles southwest of Honeydew. Movement was east at 50 mph, impacting areas near and west of Ferndale and Petrolia shortly. HAZARD...Brief Waterspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petrolia, Ferndale and Capetown. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
